results.title: Father of the man
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the first results of a survey probing Freud’s claim that the child is psychologically “father of the man”. Discusses the elaborate techniques which have been used to penetrate the secret thoughts of children, and which are giving insights into Freud’s theories.

results.title: Father of the bride. Part II
results.creator_credit: Nancy Meyers, Touchstone Pictures and Charles Shyer
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “Father of the bride” (199), itself a remake of the 1950 Vincente Minnelli film starring Elizabeth Taylor, Steve Martin reprises his role as George Banks. This time the hapless George must face becoming a grandfather, (news which triggers a mid-life crisis). along with the alarming fact that he is to be a father again. Cast includes Diane Keaton, Martin Short, Kimberly Williams, George Newbern, Kieran Culkin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nancy Meyers, Touchstone Pictures and Charles Shyer

results.title: Father of the bride
results.creator_credit: Howard Rosenman, Nancy Meyers, Carol Baum, Charles Shyer and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Steve Martin stars in this fairly rudimentary remake of the Spencer Tracey/Elizabeth Taylor original of 1950, directed by Vincente Minnelli. On her wedding day, the bride’s harried father reminisces over the rocky journey from proposal to ring swapping, for he and his family. Feeling increasingly sidelined by the trappings of the big day, George Banks (Martin) gets in to no end of trouble as he tries to steer his way through the mysterious rites of modern marrying whilst also recognising that his daughter is all grown up. Also stars Dianne Keaton and Kieran Culkin.

results.title: Father of the bride
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: Stanley Banks is a secure middle-class lawyer whose daughter, Kay, announces her wedding plans to Bickley Dunstan. From that point on, everything in Stanley’s life is turned upside down. His wife, Ellie, wants Kay to have the kind of formal wedding that she and Stanley never had. In between meeting his soon-to-be in-laws, his man-to-man talk with the groom, hosting the engagement party, financing the increasingly lavish wedding, and wondering if Kay and Buckley will resolve their differences before arriving at the altar, Stanley barely has time to deal with his own considerable anxieties about his advancing age and how his “little girl” became a woman. Cast includes Spencer Tracy, Joan Bennett, Elizabeth Taylor and Don Taylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Vincente Minnelli

results.title: Father Christmas
results.creator_credit: John Coates, Blooming Productions and Dave Unwin
results.brief_description: In this charming animation based on the book by Raymond Briggs, Father Christmas decides to take a well-earned break after delivering all his presents on Christmas Eve. From France to Scotland to Las Vegas we follow the man in the red suit as he tries to relax and enjoy himself. However, this is not always easy or even possible for the busiest man in the world. A gentle parody of the English abroad, this film is a companion piece to ‘The Snowman’, another Christmas animation based on a Raymond Briggs story.

results.title: Father and his three sons: the Bartos family
results.brief_description:
Zoltan Bartos, an amateur filmmaker and composer of popular dance music made home movies between the end of the 1920s and the middle of the 1950s.

The Bartos family present themselves in a semi-formal way to Zoltan’s camera; children dance in national costume, young wives smile and wave, relatives act out slapstick routines in imitation of ‘the movies’ and solemn groups pay their respects at the cemetary. Holiday destinations, new cars, business ventures and political rallies are all recorded as significant reference points in the life and times of the family.

Peter Forgacs gently manipulates the footage, playing with the speed and order of events, adding sound effects, voice over and the evocative music of Tibor Szemzo. The resulting film focuses our attention on both the small intimacies and larger tragedies of the family which are implied but not directly expressed in the original sequences. A couple dancing is slowed down to the point of intense romantic reverie; a woman ages before our eyes, leaving the family via divorce, never to be seen again.

The men of the family, Zoltan, his father and two brothers are captured in freeze-frame portraits, as we learn of their various fates during and after the second world war. Oversize portraits of Lenin and Stalin are carried through the streets; a fascinating dialogue between private and public history.

results.title: Father and daughter
results.creator_credit: Karl Holtsnider, Teleketics, Franciscan Communications, Corinne Hart and Lucy Liu Brown
results.brief_description: When Dr. Cortum, a devout Catholic and a medical doctor, discovered that his 18 year old daughter Michelle was experimenting with drugs he asked her to leave home rather than give a bad example to their younger children. Eventually she joined the Society For Krishna Consciousness and her lifestyle is now considerably more disciplined than before. Explores through candid interviews the past and present relationship of Dr Cortum and his daughter. Also examines what it means to stand for one’s beliefs or moral principles.

results.title: Father and daughter
results.brief_description: The poignant story of one girl’s life-long wait for her lost father. Simple brush animation takes us through a journey of time and memory in which a long for reconciliation magically occurs. Academy Award winner for Best Animation Short in 2001.

results.title: Father's kite
results.creator_credit: John Shen and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Poetic 2-D hand-drawn animated tale of a father/son relationship as they share the joys of flying a kite. Music composed and performed by John Shen. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Father's footsteps
results.creator_credit: Erika Addis, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
80 year old Coffs Harbour identical twins Toni and Adelie Hurley travel to Antarctica on a voyage commemorating Ernest Shackleton’s ill-fated expedition of 1914-16. Their father, Australian director and cinematographer Frank Hurley, was the official photographer aboard the ‘Endurance’ which was crushed by ice as it approached Antarctica, leaving the entire crew stranded on the flows for 6 months. Forced to take to the open sea in 3 small boats when the ice broke, the crew eventually landed on uninhabited Elephant Island and remained there until Shackleton organised their rescue. Toni and Adelie recount their memories of their father as they return to the region where he struggled to survive. During their voyage, they discuss their father’s photographs and diary with Jonathon Shackleton, a relative of the Irish explorer, as they approach Elephant Island. Adelie Hurley also talks about her own career, and her status as Australia’s first female press photographer. Cinematography by Erika Addis. Edited by Tony Stevens. Narrated by Anne Phelan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Erika Addis, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
